headline.main: Muslim Rebels In Philippines Free Captives

lead_paragraph: Eighty-nine hostages, most of them still in the nightclothes they were wearing when seized, were freed today by Muslim rebels in a deal with the government to end a two-day standoff. In return, the rebels, loyal to a renegade local governor, were allowed to move to another guerrilla camp 40 miles away and to avoid prosecution, at least for now.
abstract: Muslim rebels in Philippines free 89 hostages in deal with government to end two-day standoff; in return rebels, members of separatist Moro National Liberation Front, are allowed to move to another guerrilla camp and to avoid prosecution, at least for now; group's leader, Julhambri Misuari, is nephew of Nur Misuari, who was arrested in Malaysian waters as he tried to flee manhunt in Philippines; elder Misuari is being investigated by Malaysian authorities for possible connections to Abu Sayyaf, rebel group linked to Al Qaeda terrorist group (M)
